newsitem.title: UK: Grand Met names share sellers from June 19.
newsitem.headline: Grand Met names share sellers from June 19.

text.p: Grand Metropolitan Plc on Friday gave details of fund managers who sold shares in the British drinks group on Thursday.

Mercury Asset Management Group Plc sold 50 million shares at 630p per share, 200,000 at 585p, 525,000 at 580-1/2, 4,000 at 580p and 5,000 shares at 612p per. It now owns 4.93 percent of Grand Met shares.
PDFM Ltd sold 45.19 million shares at 630p per share and now holds a 2.33 percent stake.
BGI sold 255,000 at 630p per share. It now owns 2.748 percent of the shares in Grand Met.
General Accident sold 65,000 shares at 630p per share, leaving it with a 1.24 percent holding.
NatWest Asset Managers sold 102,257 shares at prices between 572p to 578p per share, 2241 at prices between 579P and 580p. It now owns 1.18 percent.
Threadneedle Asset Management sold 2.1 million shares at 630p, leaving it with a 1.629 percent stake.
Morgan Stanley Asset Management Ltd sold 2.4 million at 630p and one million at 588p. It now owns 1.271 percent.
Dealers said the shares were sold to French luxury goods group LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, which increased its stake in Grand Met to 6.29 percent on Thursday.
